Text: just wondering can i burn this file onto a blu-ray disc using a normal dvd writer

its not hd if its resolution is 1280x 544
thats 544p this is HD  1980x1080

Thank you Uploader.

Wilsy: Idiot. 
First, there's nothing about "HD". It states 720p. Conventional designation calls 720p "HD" , which is a resolution of 1280x720. "FULL HD" is 1080p, which is 1980x1080. 
Second, the new cinema format is not 16:9 widescreen anymore, but more like 2,35:1, which is even wider. Therefore, the resulting picture for 16:9 formats like HD and FULL HD is wider than the screen it is shown upon. Since the maximum screen pixels in breadth for a 720p HD TV is 1280p, the according height of the picture is around 540 pixels. So yes, this is HD and 720p. No, this is not FULL HD / 1080p.
Keep your ungrateful and misinformed comments to yourself.
